metadata.value: with two Characters and an Essay on Valour/ Now for the first time reprinted from the editions of 1633 and 1652 with one additional probleme
metadata.label: Alternate Title

metadata.value: This first page of Donne holds the Edinburgh College of Art checkout book plate from the library. A more modern addition is a barcode sticker from the ECA as well. Behind both of these is evidence of an earlier material that has been since removed, maybe a thin book plate from the previous owner, H. J. C. Grierson, or discoloration from a bookmark of some kind that was left in the front of the book. http://discovered.ed.ac.uk/primo_library/libweb/action/display.do?tabs=detailsTab&ct=display&fn=search&doc=44UOE_ALMA2197558730002466&indx=1&recIds=44UOE_ALMA2197558730002466&recIdxs=0&elementId=0&renderMode=poppedOut&displayMode=full&frbrVersion=&submit=Search&query=any%2Ccontains%2CRECA.S.117+&vl%288819882UI0%29=any&search_scope=default_scope&dscnt=0&scp.scps=scope%3A%2844UOE_DSPACE%29%2Cscope%3A%2844UOE_PURE%29%2Cscope%3A%2844UOE_ALMA%29%2Cprimo_central_multiple_fe&onCampus=false&vid=44UOE_VU1&institution=44UOE&bulkSize=10&highlight=true&tab=default_tab&dym=true&displayField=title&vl%28freeText0%29=RECA.S.117%20&dstmp=1453806370356
metadata.label: Description

metadata.value: : Binding: publisher's decorated paper over boards, with letterpress title label on spine.
metadata.label: Material

metadata.value: Grierson and Keynes were both scholars of Donne's in the 20th century. Grierson was an important Scottish literary scholar known for creating an revival interest in Donne and other 17th century poets. Keynes was best associated with Donne through his work as a biographer. It was around the time of this publication that his own biography on Donne was publishing, in 1912. Three subsequent additions were published in the following years. This exchnage between two influencial Donne scholars is an indication of the print culture of the time and the relationship between the two men.
metadata.label: Inscription Notes

metadata.value: Inscription in ms. in ink, on upper right corner of flyleaf: "H.J.C. Grierson from Geoffrey Keynes 1923". (StEdU : RECA.S.117) Purchased from J. Grant, booksellers, Edinburgh, by Edinburgh College of Art, for the Typography Department, 1 May 1950, for £1.10.0. Accession no. 3771: (See: ECA Library Accession Register Vol. 2.) (StEdU : RECA.S.117)
metadata.label: Provenance Notes

metadata.value: Paradoxes and Problemes, Front end paper recto
metadata.label: Repro Title

metadata.value: with two Characters and an Essay on Valour/ Now for the first time reprinted from the editions of 1633 and 1652 with one additional probleme
metadata.label: Alternate Title

metadata.value: Paradoxes and Problemes was the first prose that Donne completed and was probably began while he was a student at Lincoln’s Inn. Primarily a poet, this is one of his works of prose that is not one of his sermons or other religious writings. This particular edition was printed 300 years after his death when his poetry began to gain some celebrity again, after falling out of fashion after his death with people like Samuel Johnson dismissing his works for being crude and uncouth. It wasn’t until the early 20th century that modern poets began to regard his work with literary value again. The Nonesuch Press printed this edition in 1923, with two editions printed after Donne’s death and ‘with one additional PROBLEME’. Their first publication as a company was also of Donne’s works, a volume of his Love Poems. The Press was known for using a hand press to design their books and then had them printed by commercial printers in order to provide cheap versions for more people. This gives Paradoxes and Problemes the look it would have around the time when it was first being circulated. http://discovered.ed.ac.uk/primo_library/libweb/action/display.do?tabs=detailsTab&ct=display&fn=search&doc=44UOE_ALMA2197558730002466&indx=1&recIds=44UOE_ALMA2197558730002466&recIdxs=0&elementId=0&renderMode=poppedOut&displayMode=full&frbrVersion=&submit=Search&query=any%2Ccontains%2CRECA.S.117+&vl%288819882UI0%29=any&search_scope=default_scope&dscnt=0&scp.scps=scope%3A%2844UOE_DSPACE%29%2Cscope%3A%2844UOE_PURE%29%2Cscope%3A%2844UOE_ALMA%29%2Cprimo_central_multiple_fe&onCampus=false&vid=44UOE_VU1&institution=44UOE&bulkSize=10&highlight=true&tab=default_tab&dym=true&displayField=title&vl%28freeText0%29=RECA.S.117%20&dstmp=1453806370356
